alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Heavy rain showers with isolated weak thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin, southwestern Fergus and southeastern Chouteau Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain showers with isolated weak thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Geyser to 10 miles south of Denton to 6 miles southwest of Moore. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall of up to one inch in an hour with slow moving storms may cause minor flooding of low lying areas and ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Denton, Hobson, Moore, Danvers, Coffee Creek, Square Butte, Moccasin, Glengarry and Buffalo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
